alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 12:50PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central St. Bernard, southeastern St. Charles, central Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 130 PM CDT... At 1250 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds over Belle Chasse, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Belle Chasse, Jean Lafitte, Lafitte, Barataria, Poydras, Estelle and Woodmere. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in New Orleans.
